intro: Chlorospatha kressii, commonly known as the golden shield fern, is a unique species native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds that give it its common name. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with a dense rosette of leaves that form a protective layer around the central stem. Its foliage is typically bright green, with some varieties displaying a subtle yellow or gold hue on the underside of the leaves. Chlorospatha kressii prefers shaded, moist environments and is often found in humid tropical forests.
